intro: Picrasma nanophylla, commonly known as the small-leaf picrasma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes numerous species with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of dense vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Picrasma nanophylla is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
